QuestionJSON.Question: Zane is developing an interactive timeline detailing societal changes during the Renaissance due to technological progress. They want to initiate different informational pop-ups when the user hovers over or clicks on different events of the timeline. How should Zane design the computational artifact?
QuestionJSON.Answer1: Write a program to display a static timeline with textual information
QuestionJSON.Answer2: Include only hover-based instructions without any clickable events
QuestionJSON.Answer3: Design a timeline with both hover and click events that will display information about technology during the Renaissance
QuestionJSON.Answer4: Create a complex coding script that allows users to edit the timeline themselves
QuestionJSON.Explanation: In this scenario, Zane should develop an interactive timeline. This requires the use of both hover and click events which will initiate instructions to display useful information to the user. A static timeline or a timeline without clickable events will not provide the interactive experience required. Additionally, a script that allows users to edit the timeline can lead to misinformation and is not necessary for their purpose.
